RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH: Professor Titular da Universidade Federal do Rio de Janeiro no Departamento de Engenharia Industrial e no Programa de Pѓs-Graduaчуo em Informсtica e Diretor Associado de Relaчѕes Internacionais para os BRICS, da Escola Politecnica. RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH-EN: Full Professor at the Federal University of Rio de Janeiro in the Department of Industrial Engineering and in the Graduate Program in Informatics, and Associate Dean for International Affairs to BRICS Countries. PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Group Story Telling - Uso de Histѓrias Coletivas para a Captura de Conhecimento Tсcito
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: Pessoas e Organizaчѕes frequentemente necessitam recuperar eventos do passado que, por alguma razуo, nуo foram documentados quando eles ocorreram. A reconstituiчуo bem sucedida de eventos do passado depende de variсveis tais como, quanto tempo atrсs eles ocorreram e se as pessoas chaves ainda estуo ainda disponэveis para contar o que elas sabem. Embora seja difэcil em muitos casos recuperar todos os eventos conhecidos, um processo adequado de recuperaчуo pode chegar prѓximo a este objetivo. Este projeto estuda o enfoque das histѓrias coletivas contadas com o apoio de sistemas computacionais para atingir este objetivo. Os conceitos sуo aplicadas a vсrias сreas de aplicaчуo, mas principalmente: a projetos de desenvolvimento de software, a incidentes resultantes de emergъncias e рs organizaчѕes de conhecimento.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: People and organizations often need to recover events from the past that, for some reason, were not documented when they occurred. Successful reconstruction of events in the past depends on variables such as how long ago they occurred and whether key people are still available to tell what they know. Although it is difficult in many cases to recover all known events, an adequate recovery process can come close to this goal. This project studies the focus of collective stories told with the support of computer systems to achieve this objective. The concepts are applied to several application areas, but mainly: to software development projects, to incidents resulting from emergencies and to knowledge organizations.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: Group Story Telling - Use of Collective Stories to Capture Tacit Knowledge

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Aplicando os conceitos da Engenharia de Resiliъncia e da Anсlise Ergonєmica ao Trabalho dos Pilotos de Helicѓpteros na Bacia de Campos
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO:
3.1 Objetivo Geral
O objeto geral do projeto щ identificar e analisar as estratщgias que incrementem a resiliъncia destas organizaчѕes, de modo a implantс-las e difundi-las em todos os setores e demais organizaчѕes e, assim, capacitar os trabalhadores para anteceder e prever acontecimentos inesperados, minimizando as conseqќъncias de possэveis incidentes, sob o enfoque e metodologias de anсlise ergonєmica preconizadas pela Ergonomia Cognitiva e de Engenharia de Resiliъncia.
3.2 Objetivos Especэficos
a)	Caracterizar a atividade dos pilotos e os fatores humanos que compѕe as organizaчѕes, buscando principalmente diferenчas nas tarefas prescritas e atividades reais;
b)	Identificar possэveis estratщgias individuais utilizadas pelos pilotos para execuчуo de seu trabalho (modelos de regulaчуo interna) que possam contribuir para prevenчуo de erros e falhas na execuчуo da atividade;
c)	Identificar as operaчѕes nas quais a complexidade proporciona maior probabilidade de ocorrъncia de lapsos, disfunчѕes, incidentes e erros humanos de uma forma geral;
d)	Identificar as condiчѕes latentes que possam conduzir a erros e falhas no processo produtivo;
e)	Investigar os incidentes ocorridos na organizaчуo nos њltimos anos e identificar os seus fatores de risco, de acordo com a natureza do seu sistema: humano, tщcnico ou organizacional;
f)	Estabelecer correlaчѕes entre fatores de risco e os incidentes;
g)	Analisar os procedimentos e condutas recomendadas pela empresa em situaчѕes de incidentes;
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO-INGLES:
3.1 General objective
The general objective of the project is to identify and analyze strategies that increase the resilience of these organizations, in order to implement and disseminate them in all sectors and other organizations and, thus, enable workers to anticipate and predict unexpected events, minimizing the consequences of possible incidents, under the focus and ergonomic analysis methodologies recommended by Cognitive Ergonomics and Resilience Engineering.
3.2 Specific Objectives
a) To characterize the pilots' activity and the human factors that compose the organizations, mainly looking for differences in the prescribed tasks and real activities;
b) Identify possible individual strategies used by pilots to carry out their work (internal regulation models) that can contribute to the prevention of errors and failures in the execution of the activity;
c) Identify the operations in which complexity provides a greater probability of the occurrence of lapses, dysfunctions, incidents and human errors in general;
d) Identify latent conditions that can lead to errors and failures in the production process;
e) Investigate incidents that have occurred in the organization in recent years and identify its risk factors, according to the nature of its system: human, technical or organizational;
f) Establish correlations between risk factors and incidents;
g) Analyze the procedures and conduct recommended by the company in situations of incidents;
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: Applying the concepts of Resilience Engineering and Ergonomic Analysis to the Work of Helicopter Pilots in the Campos Basin

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO:

enfermo, ferido ou parturiente em situaчуo de urgъncia ou emergъncia, e transportс-lo

Este projeto tem como objetivos, mediante a anсlise das atividades da Central

questѕes:
 Tratamento das solicitaчѕes ao serviчo 192, a fim de melhorar a produtividade
da operaчуo, tendo em vista que mais da metade das chamadas atuais sуo
desperdiчadas devido a quedas de ligaчуo, enganos, trotes e outros tipos de

 Dificuldade de processamento das chamadas ao serviчo 192, devido a

10/22
 Falta de confiabilidade do sistema de gestуo da frota de ambulтncias e das
suas respectivas equipes.
Para os objetivos da seчуo anterior, foram fixadas as metas abaixo , conforme

 Desenvolver mщtodo de anсlise de centrais de atendimento de emergъncia

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO-INGLES:
The Ministry of Health, through Ordinance 1864 / GM, in September 2003,
started the implementation of the emergency mobile component with the creation of SAMU-192
(Emergency mobile care service). SAMU - RJ is responsible for
Mobile Emergency Care and inter-hospital patient transfers
hospitalized by the Unified Health System (SUS). He must be able to
answer, by telephone 192 within its region of coverage, any and all
sick, injured or parturient in an urgent or emergency situation, and transport him
safely and accompanying health professionals to the hospital level of the
system.
This project aims to analyze the activities of the Central
Medical Regulation of SAMU-RJ, propose and develop solutions for the following
questions:
 Handling service requests 192 in order to improve productivity
operation, considering that more than half of the current calls are
wasted due to dropped connections, mistakes, prank calls and other types of
losses, as indicated by the historical series obtained by the SAMU-RJ management.
 Difficulty in processing calls to the 192 service, due to possible inadequacies in the software provided by DATASUS, and / or its
use.
 Lack of reliability of the ambulance fleet management system and of the
their respective teams.
For the objectives of the previous section, the goals below have been set, as
following description:
 Develop a method for analyzing emergency call centers based on the principles of Ergonomics and Resilience Engineering
 Develop ergonomic systems based on Information Technology to support the collaborative work of Central operators
 Method development for the design of interfaces for call centers in the emergency domain ,.
 Development of a method for the center layout design
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: Applying the Principles of Resilience Engineering and Ergonomics to the Emergency Domain for Developing Solutions in Information Technology

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Levantamento de Requisitos Cognitivos para o Desenvolvimento de um Sistema de Comando e Controle para Gestуo da Resposta р Emergъncia baseado na Anсlise do Trabalho Cognitivo e nos Princэpios da Engenharia de Resiliъncia
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO:
Os acidentes clсssicos de Three Mile Island (TMI) e, principalmente, de Chernobyl mostraram que a energia nuclear tem riscos incalculсveis para as pessoas e para o ambiente. Alщm desses, outros acidentes clсssicos, mas fora da сrea nuclear, como por exemplo: Vazamento Quэmico de Bhopal em 1984, a Explosуo na Cidade do Mщxico em 1984, Vila Socѓ - Cubatуo em 1984, o Acidente Radioativo de Goiтnia em 1986, Ataque ao World Trade Center em 2001 e Furacуo Katrina em 2005 apresentam problemas semelhantes, que servem como referъncia para um estudo mais apurado de coordenaчуo, controle e tomadas de decisуo nesse tipo de contexto. 
Ambientes de eventos adversos exigem formas gerenciais de emergъncia ou de crise dinтmicos, por variaчѕes de cenсrios, e complexos, pela interconexуo de vсrias partes do sistema. Tal tipo de ambiente demanda muita habilidade para manutenчуo do controle da situaчуo, caracterizando-o como um sistema cognitivo complexo. Assim, no caso de um acidente nuclear, a necessidade de se aprender e de se adaptar aos novos contextos щ muito acentuada e contэnua. Portanto, os Sistemas de Comando e Controle sуo amplamente utilizados nos mais diversos domэnios, mais especialmente nos Sistemas de Serviчo de Emergъncia (envolvendo Polэcia, Corpo de Bombeiros, Defesa Civil, Resgate Mщdico-SAMU, etc.). 
Nesta pesquisa, o trabalho tem por objetivo geral melhorar o sistema de comando e controle para a gestуo resposta рs emergъncias no Estado do Rio de Janeiro no тmbito da Defesa Civil, tendo como foco principal as emergъncias nucleares nas usinas de Angra dos Reis. 
Os objetivos especэficos sуo:
1)	Captura e registro em сudio e vэdeo da simulaчуo da resposta р emergъncia nuclear no CCEN em Angra dos Reis 
2)	Analise ergonєmica da simulaчуo com base na metodologia de Analise do Trabalho Cognitivo (Crandall et ali,2006);
3)	Modelagem da Atividade Cognitiva e levantamento de requisitos cognitivos para especificaчуo de ferramentas computacionais para o coordenador
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO-INGLES:
The classic accidents of Three Mile Island (TMI) and, especially, Chernobyl showed that nuclear energy has incalculable risks for people and the environment. In addition to these, other classic accidents, but outside the nuclear area, such as: Bhopal Chemical Leak in 1984, the Explosion in Mexico City in 1984, Vila Socѓ - Cubatуo in 1984, the Radioactive Accident of Goiтnia in 1986, Attack on World Trade Center in 2001 and Hurricane Katrina in 2005 present similar problems, which serve as a reference for a more accurate study of coordination, control and decision making in this type of context.
Adverse events environments require dynamic forms of emergency or crisis management, due to variations in scenarios, and complex, due to the interconnection of various parts of the system. Such an environment requires a lot of skill to maintain control of the situation, characterizing it as a complex cognitive system. Thus, in the case of a nuclear accident, the need to learn and adapt to new contexts is very strong and continuous. Therefore, the Command and Control Systems are widely used in the most diverse domains, more especially in the Emergency Service Systems (involving Police, Fire Department, Civil Defense, Medical Rescue-SAMU, etc.).
In this research, the work has the general objective of improving the command and control system for the management of emergency response in the State of Rio de Janeiro in the scope of Civil Defense, focusing mainly on nuclear emergencies in the Angra dos Reis plants.
The specific objectives are:
1) Capture and record in audio and video the simulation of the nuclear emergency response at CCEN in Angra dos Reis
2) Ergonomic analysis of the simulation based on the Cognitive Work Analysis methodology (Crandall et ali, 2006);
3) Modeling of Cognitive Activity and survey of cognitive requirements for the specification of computational tools for the coordinator
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: Survey of Cognitive Requirements for the Development of a Command and Control System for Emergency Response Management based on the Analysis of Cognitive Work and the Principles of Resilience Engineering

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Aplicando os Princэpios da Engenharia de Resiliъncia, Ergonomia e Learning Lab ao Domэnio Emergъncia: para os Exercэcios Simulados de Resposta: um estudo de caso dos exercэcios simulados de evacuaчуo de populaчуo em сreas de risco no Rio de Janeiro
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO:
Os eventos de chuva extrema jс ocasionaram grandes tragщdias no Brasil, como as inundaчѕes de 2008 e 2009 em Santa Catarina e as enchentes no Rio de Janeiro em 1966, 1988, 1996, 1998 e 2010. Nestas ocasiѕes, os deslizamentos de terra provocaram inњmeras perdas humanas, alщm de prejuэzos econєmicos e milhares de desabrigados.
A tragщdia de fevereiro de 1996 no Rio de Janeiro motivou a criaчуo do Sistema de Alerta de Chuvas Intensas e de Deslizamentos em Encostas da Cidade do Rio de Janeiro (Alerta Rio), que tem como objetivo emitir boletins de alerta р populaчуo e aos ѓrgуos municipais sobre o risco de ocorrъncia de chuvas intensas que possam provocar inundaчѕes ou deslizamentos na cidade. 
Todo e qualquer tipo de exercэcio de simulaчуo envolve treinamentos e anсlises complexas para representar o mundo real em forma de cenсrio controlсvel. As organizaчѕes, de maneira geral, tendem a adotar estratщgias distintas para lidar com desastres inerentes р atividade fim do sistema e com possэveis anomalias ou falhas que podem ocorrer para as quais nenhum treinamento ou procedimento foram atщ entуo previstos. Baseado no exposto, e utilizando a literatura de engenharia de resiliъncia e ergonomia e aplicando a metodologia do learning lab, щ indiscutivelmente prioritсrio que os exercэcios de simulaчуo sejam capazes de maximizar o entendimento da rede na qual a organizaчуo estс inserida, de difundir o conhecimento entre os agentes participantes e de estruturar o papel de cada um na resposta a uma emergъncia real.
Este projeto tem como objetivos, mediante a anсlise dos exercэcios simulados para evacuaчуo da populaчуo de сreas de riscos quando da ocorrъncia de chuvas fortes na Cidade do Rio de Janeiro, coordenados pela Subsecretaria de Defesa Civil da Prefeitura da cidade, propor e desenvolver soluчѕes para as seguintes questѕes:
?	Anсlise do projeto de preparaчуo dos exercэcios simulados de evacuaчуo da populaчуo que habita сreas de riscos, quando da ocorrъncia de chuvas fortes
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO-INGLES:
The heavy rainfall events have caused great tragedies in Brazil, as the floods of 2008 and 2009 in Santa Catarina and flooding in Rio de Janeiro in 1966, 1988, 1996, 1998 and 2010. On these occasions, landslides caused numerous human casualties, and economic losses and thousands homeless.
The tragedy of February 1996 in Rio de Janeiro led to the creation of the Alert System Intense Rainfall and Landslides on Slopes of the City of Rio de Janeiro (Rio Alert), which aims to provide updates and alert the population to the municipal bodies about the risk of heavy rains that could cause floods and landslides in the city.
Any type of exercise training and simulation involves complex analyzes to represent the real world in the form of manageable scenario. Organizations, in general, tend to adopt different strategies for dealing with disasters inherent to the activity order of the system and possible malfunctions or failures that may occur for which no training or procedure were hitherto provided. Based on the above, and using the literature on resilience engineering and ergonomics and applying the methodology of the learning lab, is unquestionably a priority that simulation exercises are able to maximize the understanding of the network in which the organization operates, to spread the knowledge among agents and participants to structure the role of each in response to a real emergency.
This project aims, through the analysis of simulated exercises for evacuation of the population in risk areas with the occurrence of heavy rains in the city of Rio de Janeiro, coordinated by the Secretariat for Civil Defense of City Hall, propose and develop solutions to following questions:
? Analysis of project preparation exercise simulated the evacuation of the population living in risk areas, upon the occurrence of heavy rainfall in the city of Rio de Janeiro;
? Capture and analyze data regarding the drills performed based on the planning of the previous item, in accordance with th
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: Applying Resilience Engineering, Ergonomics, and Learning Lab to Emergency Response Simulation to Prevent Disaster in Rio de Janeiro

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Ergonomia Cognitiva e Resiliъncia: aplicaчуo dos conceitos de aprendizagem acelerada no programa de exercэcios simulados da Defesa Civil do Rio de Janeiro.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: Objetivo Geral Este projeto tem como objetivo geral avaliar a aquisiчуo de conhecimento р luz dos conceitos de Aprendizagem Acelerada, Ergonomia Cognitiva e Engenharia de Resiliъncia, mediante mщtodo a ser desenvolvido de anсlise dos exercэcios simulados para evacuaчуo da populaчуo de сreas de riscos quando da ocorrъncia de chuvas fortes na Cidade do Rio de Janeiro, coordenados pela Subsecretaria de Defesa Civil da Prefeitura da cidade, tanto no que diz respeito ao quadros tщcnicos da Defesa Civil e de гrgуos afins da Prefeitura do Rio de Janeiro bem como da populaчуo participante dos exercэcios: - Anсlise do projeto de preparaчуo dos exercэcios simulados de evacuaчуo da populaчуo que habita сreas de riscos, quando da ocorrъncia de chuvas fortes na Cidade do Rio de Janeiro; - Captura e anсlise dos dados referente aos exercэcios simulados realizados com base no planejamento do item anterior, de acordo com os conceitos e metodologia da Ergonomia (Cognitiva, Fэsica e Organizacional), e da Engenharia de Resiliъncia; - Comparaчуo entre planejado e realizado, visando aumentar a resiliъncia da Cidade do Rio de Janeiro, atravщs de aquisiчуo de conhecimento das equipes da defesa civil e do conhecimento adquirido pela populaчуo que vive em сrea de risco, atravщs dos exercэcios simulados. 3.2. Objetivos Especэficos Para os objetivos especэfcos, foram fixadas as metas abaixo , conforme descriчуo a seguir: - Desenvolver um mщtodo de anсlise dos planos e dos exercэcios simulados aplicando os conceitos abordados pela Aprendizagem Acelerada apoiado pelos princэpios da Ergonomia/Anсlise Ergonomoica do Trabalho e da Engenharia de Resiliъncia; - Desenvolvimento de um sistema de melhoria contэnua dos exercэcios simulados com base nas analises anteriores visando aquisiчуo de conhecimento e aumentar a resiliъncia a desastres da Subsecretaria de Defesa Civil e conseqќentemente da Cidade do Rio de Janeiro; - Como conseqќъncia da obtenчуo destas metas, deve ser alcanчada uma significativa melhoria dos indicadores gerenciais da Subsecretaria de Defesa Civil da Cidade do Rio de Janeiro.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: General Objective This project has the general objective of evaluating the acquisition of knowledge in the light of the concepts of Accelerated Learning, Cognitive Ergonomics and Resilience Engineering, using a method to be developed to analyze the simulated exercises to evacuate the population from risk areas when the occurrence of heavy rains in the City of Rio de Janeiro, coordinated by the Civil Defense Secretariat of the City Hall, both with regard to the technical staff of Civil Defense and related bodies of the City of Rio de Janeiro as well as the population participating in the exercises: - Analysis of the project to prepare simulated evacuation exercises for the population living in risk areas, when heavy rains occur in the city of Rio de Janeiro; - Capture and analysis of data referring to simulated exercises performed based on the planning of the previous item, according to the concepts and methodology of Ergonomics (Cognitive, Physical and Organizational), and Resilience Engineering; - Comparison between planned and realized, aiming to increase the resilience of the City of Rio de Janeiro, through the acquisition of knowledge from the civil defense teams and the knowledge acquired by the population living in a risk area, through the simulated exercises. 3.2. Specific Objectives For the specific objectives, the goals below were set, as described below: - Develop a method of analysis of the simulated plans and exercises applying the concepts covered by Accelerated Learning supported by the principles of Ergonomics / Ergonomic Analysis of Work and Engineering Resilience; - Development of a system of continuous improvement of the simulated exercises based on the previous analyzes, aiming at acquiring knowledge and increasing the resilience to disasters of the Sub-Secretariat of Civil Defense and consequently of the City of Rio de Janeiro; - As a consequence of achieving these goals, a significant improvement in the management indicators of the Sub-Secretariat for Civil Defense of the City of Rio de Janeiro must be achieved.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: Cognitive Ergonomics and Resilience: application of accelerated learning concepts in the Civil Defense simulated exercise program in Rio de Janeiro.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Modelagem de sistemas integrados de comando e controle para aumentar a resiliъncia e acelerar a aprendizagem em situaчѕes de emergъncia
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO:
Desastres naturais, acidentes tecnolѓgicos, atentados terroristas, situaчѕes indesejadas em grandes
eventos envolvendo multidѕes (incъndios, manifestaчѕes violentas) mostram que a gestуo de situaчѕes de emergъncias щ um problema de grande complexidade, agravado pelo risco de perda de vidas humanas.
As organizaчѕes de planejamento, monitoraчуo e resposta encontram-se diante de desafios como a gravidade, a raridade e as caracterэsticas њnicas de cada situaчуo, de modo que os trabalhadores precisam se preparar para o inesperado e nуo desejado, o grande paradoxo que a engenharia de resiliъncia procura abordar. Deste modo, as organizaчѕes precisam ter novas abordagens para concepчуo de suas estruturas e processos, considerando os aportes teѓricos e prсticos de diversas disciplinas como Ergonomia Cognitiva e Engenharia de Resiliъncia para desenvolver conceitos de uso, modos de operaчуo, e programas de treinamento, levando em consideraчуo as caracterэsticas inerentes aos sistemas complexos. As equipes de comando e controle destes sistemas devem estar aptas para interagir e realizar adaptaчѕes para lidar com os ambientes externo e interno em constante mudanчa, e seu modelo de organizaчуo pode ser determinante р sua eficсcia. As pessoas devem ser preparadas para prover a resiliъncia, lidando com eventos inesperados no limite das capacidades do sistema de modo a mantъ-lo em funcionamento seguro. O objetivo principal desta proposta щ o estudo das interaчѕes em sistemas complexos de modo conceber estruturas organizacionais, modelos de sistemas integrados de comando e controle e processos de treinamento que permitam рs pessoas mais facilidade para criar estratщgias para lidar com situaчѕes novas, com mais recursos para aчуo e possibilitando a aceleraчуo do aprendizado organizacional. A metodologia parte de estudos de campo em sistemas complexos tais como como gestуo de emergъncias e sistemas de comando e controle integrados. A anсlise irс considerar as interaчѕes entre os agentes humanos (comunicaчуo, colaboraчуo, coatividade, cooperaчуo), entre estes e os sistemas tщcnicos (funчѕes, dependъncias, interaчуo humano computador) e com o ambiente (organizaчуo) de trabalho. A partir do detalhamento dos problemas, iremos identificar os principais elementos, suas interaчѕes e comportamentos para satisfazer requisitos inicialmente associados aos aspectos da complexidade. Na fase seguinte serуo propostos modelos para
 

	
melhorar os processos de interaчуo em comando e controle para aumentar a resiliъncia e acelerar o aprendizado organizacional. A vinda de um especialista internacionalmente reconhecido na сrea de Engenharia de Resiliъncia e Comando e Controle, como o professor Hollnagel, visa ampliar o conhecimento nacional sobre a gestуo de sistemas complexos, nos тmbitos da engenharia de produчуo, ciъncia da computaчуo e comando e controle, por meio da criaчуo de uma rede de conhecimento internacional sobre os temas de pesquisa propostos, de modo a alavancar a produчуo cientэfica dos membros da equipe brasileira e melhorar a qualidade da formaчуo nos programas de pѓs-graduaчуo envolvidos.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO-INGLES:
Natural disasters, technological accidents, terrorist attacks, unwanted situations in large
events involving crowds (fires, violent demonstrations) show that the management of emergency situations is a problem of great complexity, aggravated by the risk of loss of human lives.
Planning, monitoring and response organizations face challenges such as severity, rarity and the unique characteristics of each situation, so that workers need to prepare for the unexpected and unwanted, the great paradox that engineering resilience seeks to address. Thus, organizations need to have new approaches for the design of their structures and processes, considering the theoretical and practical contributions of different disciplines such as Cognitive Ergonomics and Resilience Engineering to develop concepts of use, modes of operation, and training programs, taking into account taking into account the inherent characteristics of complex systems. The command and control teams of these systems must be able to interact and adapt to deal with the constantly changing external and internal environments, and their organizational model can be decisive for their effectiveness. People must be prepared to provide resilience by dealing with unexpected events to the limit of the system's capabilities in order to keep it running safely. The main objective of this proposal is the study of interactions in complex systems in order to conceive organizational structures, models of integrated command and control systems and training processes that allow people to more easily create strategies to deal with new situations, with more resources for action and enabling the acceleration of organizational learning. The methodology starts from field studies in complex systems such as emergency management and integrated command and control systems. The analysis will consider the interactions between human agents (communication, collaboration, coactivity, cooperation), between these and technical systems (functions, dependencies, human computer interaction) and with the work environment (organization). From the details of the problems, we will identify the main elements, their interactions and behaviors to satisfy requirements initially associated with aspects of complexity. In the next phase, models will be proposed for improving command and control interaction processes to increase resilience and accelerate organizational learning. The arrival of an internationally recognized specialist in the field of Resilience and Command and Control Engineering, such as Professor Hollnagel, aims to expand national knowledge about the management of complex systems, in the fields of production engineering, computer science and command and control, through the creation of an international knowledge network on the proposed research themes, in order to leverage the scientific production of the members of the Brazilian team and improve the quality of training in the graduate programs involved.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: Modeling of integrated command and control systems to increase resilience and accelerate learning in emergency situations

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Ergonomia Cognitiva e Engenharia de Resiliъncia: aplicaчуo dos conceitos de aprendizagem acelerada no Centro de Comando e Controle do Estado do Rio de Janeiro.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO:
Este projeto tem como objetivo geral avaliar a aquisiчуo de conhecimento р luz dos conceitos de Aprendizagem Acelerada, Ergonomia Cognitiva e Engenharia de Resiliъncia, mediante mщtodo a ser desenvolvido de anсlise do Centro de Comando e Controle do Estado Rio de Janeiro, que funciona com 35 organizaчѕes composta de instituiчѕes publicas e privadas visando apoiar e gerenciar os grandes eventos que a Cidade do Rio de Janeiro vai receber nos prѓximos anos: Jornada Mundial da Juventude, Copa do Mundo e Jogos Olimpicos, bem como analisar o material registrado em сudio e vэdeos da Copa das Confederaчѕes e as grandes manifestaчѕes na cidade:
- Captura e anсlise dos dados referente aos eventos ocorridos com base no planejamento do item anterior, de acordo com os conceitos e metodologia da Ergonomia (Cognitiva, Fэsica e Organizacional), e da Engenharia de Resiliъncia;
- Comparaчуo entre planejado e realizado, visando aumentar a resiliъncia da Cidade do Rio de Janeiro, atravщs de aquisiчуo de conhecimento das equipes que estiveram operando durantes os eventos e quais as liчѕes aprendidas.
- Anсlise do projeto do centro de Comando e Controle e sua doutrina e identificaчуo de melhorias
A principal contribuiчуo visa aplicar os conceitos de Aprendizagem Acelerada que estуo ainda em desenvolvimento nas comunidades cientэficas estadunidense e europщia, no domэnio emergъncia que tem sido uma preocupaчуo de primeira linha atualmente no pais visando incrementar a resiliъncia a grandes eventos na cidade do Rio de Janeiro.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO-INGLES:
This project aims to evaluate the acquisition of knowledge in the light of the concepts of Accelerated Learning, Cognitive Ergonomics and Resilience Engineering, using a method to be developed by the Rio de Janeiro State Command and Control Center, which works with 35 organizations composed of public and private institutions aiming to support and manage the major events that the City of Rio de Janeiro will host in the coming years: World Youth Day, World Cup and Olympic Games, as well as analyze the recorded material and videos of the World Cup Confederations and major demonstrations in the city:
- Capture and analysis of data related to events that occurred based on the planning of the previous item, according to the concepts and methodology of Ergonomics (Cognitive, Physical and Organizational), and of Resilience Engineering;
- Comparison between planned and realized, aiming to increase the resilience of the City of Rio de Janeiro, through the acquisition of knowledge of the teams that were operating during the events and what lessons were learned.
- Analysis of the Command and Control center project and its doctrine and identification of improvements
The main contribution aims to apply the concepts of Accelerated Learning that are still under development in the American and European scientific communities, in the emergency domain, which has been a first-line concern currently in the country, aiming to increase resilience to major events in the city of Rio de Janeiro.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: Cognitive Ergonomics and Resilience Engineering: application of the concepts of accelerated learning in the Command and Control Center of the State of Rio de Janeiro.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Case Studies of Living Materials Supply during Covid-19 Pandemic
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO:
O projeto tem como objetivo fazer levantamento de estudos de caso paradigmсticos nos paэses dos BRICS acerca da cadeia de suprimentos de alimentos durante a pandemia de Covid-19, tem como caracterэsticas fundamentais a organizaчуo popular.
O segundo objetivo щ transformar estes casos em material pedagѓgico para os estudos do International Master in Engineering Management, coordenado pela Tsinghua University, Beijing, China.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO-INGLES:
The project aims to survey paradigmatic case studies in the BRICS countries about the food supply chain during the Covid-19 pandemic, with popular organization as fundamental characteristics.
The second objective is to transform these cases into teaching material for the studies of the International Master in Engineering Management, coordinated by Tsinghua University, Beijing, China.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES:
Abstract
Resilience Engineering aims to make people and organizations sensitive to the risk models adopted and to the adaptive strategies used to control the emergency and the failure paths. A resilient organization must provide means to the management of adaptations by monitoring, understanding, reflecting and learning from these strategies, and by identifying threats and risks to safety. The failure in applying such principles leads the organization to act in a reactive model, in an endless fight against danger. The case studies presented in this article seek to apply the concepts and methods of resilience engineering, relating them to the concept of complex socio-technical systemsД sustainability, in a recently industrialized country like Brazil. The cases approach the domains of nuclear, aviation, and emergency, using Cognitive Task Analysis as methodological basis. The studies have permitted to identify resilience and brittleness factors in the several domains researched; pointing out that a proactive safety management system based on resilience engineering concepts may provide the organizations with effective means to balance safety and productivity goals.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Natural disasters, particularly those triggered by heavy rainfall, may cause major damage and death. However, if an accurate early warning is issued, the damage can be mitigated. In Latin America and Brazil, characteristics of socioeconomic development often lead to a disorderly growth of cities and, consequently, occupation and irregular construction in risk areas. Therefore, forecasts of heavy rainfall, as well as preventative and mitigatory actions based on meteorological data/alerts, are essential to saving lives and minimizing material loss. An event that would have benefited from such actions is that which occurred in the mountainous region of Rio de Janeiro in January 2011, when over 800 people lost their lives. This work describes the first research initiative on resilience engineering domain in systems to forecast heavy rains in Rio de Janeiro. The results indicate important sources of brittleness in the system that supports the work of meteorologists, mainly related to the technical and organizational framework, and suggests that the main source of resilience in dealing with critical situations is the tacit knowledge of experts.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES:
In order to study and analyze the work of the Fire Department of Rio de Janeiro, this
work brings an immersion in the functioning of the work activities of the corporation by
the cognitive and ergonomic concept. From a real simulated exercise applied at the
Officers' School, the research contemplates a lot of operational material and shows in
depth the actions of the Firefighters. In addition, it relies on the modeling of the prescribed
and the real work to determine points of weakness and the possible consequences that
can occur from lack of activity or not. This material also proposes a new method of
comparing the real work and the prescribed work, with the aim of making the prescribed
task even closer to the work performed by the operator.
Keywords: Cognitive work; Simulation; Prescribed work; work as done.
